head.title: On the Grand Day for Bush, American Voices

hedline.hl1: On the Grand Day for Bush, American Voices

abstract.p: Kathleen Whitley-Bartell letter scores policies of Republican Party (Aug 1 article)

block.p: Re ''Republicans Open Convention, Emphasizing Unity'' (front page, Aug. 1):

A truly democratic party remembers its poor and reaches out in times of prosperity to lift all boats in a rising economy -- not just those of the already rich and powerful. It respects a woman's right to choose, and ensures equal rights for gays and all minorities not because of political correctness but because it is the right thing to do. It does everything in its power to enact laws that protect our environment. Most important, it reaches out to other countries in peace, not with the aggressive promotion of ''Star Wars'' fantasies.
Re ''Republicans Open Convention, Emphasizing Unity'' (front page, Aug. 1):

A truly democratic party remembers its poor and reaches out in times of prosperity to lift all boats in a rising economy -- not just those of the already rich and powerful. It respects a woman's right to choose, and ensures equal rights for gays and all minorities not because of political correctness but because it is the right thing to do. It does everything in its power to enact laws that protect our environment. Most important, it reaches out to other countries in peace, not with the aggressive promotion of ''Star Wars'' fantasies.

These are not the ways of the Republican Party, as George W. Bush's and Dick Cheney's records show. These are not the ideals of the Republican Party, despite the stage show that it is putting on in Philadelphia.
All the truly important progress we've made is in serious jeopardy in the event of a Bush-Cheney victory.
